title: Find Pivot Index
patternTriggers: Find pivot where left sum = right sum? Use total sum. Check if leftSum == totalSum - leftSum - current.

approaches.name: Brute Force - Calculate Both Sides
approaches.intuition: For each index, calculate sum of left elements and sum of right elements, check if equal.
approaches.approach: For each index, use two loops to calculate left and right sums.

complexity.timeExplanation: For each index, calculating sums takes O(n)

approaches.name: Prefix and Suffix Arrays
approaches.intuition: Precompute prefix sums (left) and suffix sums (right). Check where prefix[i-1] == suffix[i+1].
approaches.approach: Build prefix and suffix sum arrays, then check for pivot point.

complexity.spaceExplanation: Two arrays for prefix and suffix

approaches.name: Single Pass with Total Sum - Optimal
approaches.intuition: Key: leftSum + nums[i] + rightSum = total. So rightSum = total - leftSum - nums[i]. Check if leftSum == rightSum.
approaches.approach: Calculate total sum first. Iterate with running leftSum, calculate rightSum on the fly.

complexity.timeExplanation: Two passes: one for total, one to find pivot

commonMistakes: Not handling edge cases (single element, all zeros)
Not realizing rightSum can be calculated from total
Forgetting to return -1 when no pivot found
hints: Check if leftSum == rightSum at each position
Only need one pass after calculating total
Update leftSum AFTER checking, not before
